entities.Ti: railway trip speeds and areal coverage the emperor s new clothes of effectivity
entities.E: {"DN":"Railway trip speeds and areal coverage. The emperor’s new clothes of effectivity?","D":"Abstract\r\nEurope’s railways have experienced a general decline in the second half of the 20th century and a renaissance since the 1980s. Total network length has decreased fundamentally while high-speed rail (HSR) line construction has soared since then. Accordingly HSR has stipulated a lot of research, but only recently HSR’s impacts on settlement structure and transport regimes have been studied in depth. We embrace a passenger’s point of view and utilize a generalized overview model for illustrating the trade-offs between trip speeds of complete trip chains, access/egress legs and mainline trip lengths. In order to estimate input parameters, an overview of railway network and settlement structure of Austria is empirically derived. In four scenarios, we vary these input parameters to study the impact of timetable integration, speed upgrades on mainlines and access/egress modes on trip speed in the Austrian case. Our results show that travel speed advantages of mainline speed increases are quickly countervailed by access/egress improvements or timetable integration improvements. We conclude that finding harmonized optimum speeds, introducing clock-face timetable design and improving access/egress modes are promising strategies in comparison to unscrutinized further maximization of mainline travel speed levels at the expense of feeder/distributor lines quality.","S":[{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0966692314001380"},{"Ty":1,"U":"https://www.deepdyve.com/lp/elsevier/railway-trip-speeds-and-areal-coverage-the-emperor-s-new-clothes-of-hAiXGo4mpR"},{"Ty":1,"U":"https://trid.trb.org/view.aspx?id=1322678"},{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.researchgate.net/profile/Tadej_Brezina/publication/264241430_Railway_trip_speeds_and_areal_coverage._The_emperors_new_clothes_of_effectivity/links/54342fa20cf294006f73501c.pdf?disableCoverPage=true"}],"VFN":"Journal of Transport Geography","V":39,"I":0,"FP":121,"LP":130,"DOI":"10.1016/j.jtrangeo.2014.06.024"}

entities.Ti: infoconnectivity the value of certainty and uncertainty for interconnected transport networks
entities.E: {"DN":"Infoconnectivity - the value of certainty and uncertainty for interconnected transport networks","D":"Human behavior regarding transport depends on travel time estimation and not on measured travel times. Travel time is dependent on human body energy consumption for diff erent activities, which has been studied by the author over the last 30 years. Uncertainty can enhance time perception up to a factor of 5 compared to measured time, dependent on the certainty or uncertainty of the information system. Quantitative analysis has shown that information improvements at interchanges of transport systems can have a value equal to or even greater than time saving produced by expensive, huge infrastructure projects. The paper will present empirical results from studies over the last 40 years and the theoretical background.","S":[{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.jbe-platform.com/content/journals/10.1075/idj.17.2.02kno"},{"Ty":1,"U":"http://cat.inist.fr/?aModele=afficheN&cpsidt=22281433"},{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/jbp/idj/2009/00000017/00000002/art00002"},{"Ty":0,"U":"http://openurl.ingenta.com/content/xref?genre=article&issn=0142-5471&volume=17&issue=2&spage=85"}],"VFN":"Information Design Journal","V":17,"I":2,"FP":85,"LP":90,"DOI":"10.1075/idj.17.2.02kno"}

{"DN":"Schneller – öfter – weiter – immer dümmer","D":"Jede Beschleunigung erhoht das Risiko und die Haufigkeit von Fehlern, wenn Ruckkopplung und Kontrolle nicht folgen konnen. Die technische Beschleunigung sowohl in der physischen Mobilitat wie auch im Informationssystem fuhrt nicht, wie zu erwarten ware, zu intelligenteren, sondern zu dummeren Ergebnissen. Was im Individualbereich zunachst als groser Vorteil erscheint - die mit externer Energie angetriebenen Verkehrsmittel, insbesondere das Auto - fuhrt im System zu immer groserer Abhangigkeit von ausen und zu Siedlungsstrukturen, die nicht nachhaltig sind. Die Dummheit der Verkehrs- und Stadtplanung muss von den Bewohnern mit immer groserem Einsatz immer teurer werdender Energie bezahlt werden. Die Ursache liegt in der heutigen Parkraumorganisation, die die Gesellschaft zwingt, an jedem Ort ihrer Aktivitaten in unmittelbarer Nahe Parkplatze anzuordnen, eine Folge der Reichsgaragenordnung aus 1939. Diese zwanghaft physische Kopplung kann nur aufgelost werden, wenn man sie physisch lost, indem die Wege zum geparkten Auto nicht kurzer sein durfen als die zur Haltestelle des offentlichen Verkehrs und auch im Autoverkehr die Marktwirtschaft eingefuhrt wird. Dies fuhrt zu intelligenteren Losungen nicht nur in den Siedlungsstrukturen, sondern auch im individuellen Verhalten.","S":[{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.ssoar.info/ssoar/handle/document/26890"},{"Ty":1,"U":"https://ideas.repec.org/h/zbw/arlaba/60201.html"},{"Ty":1,"U":"http://econpapers.repec.org/RePEc:zbw:arlaba:60201"}]}

entities.Ti: ankara da ulaşim turlerinin enerji kullanimi ve mekansal yapiya etkileri
entities.E: {"DN":"ANKARA'DA ULAŞIM TÜRLERİNİN ENERJİ KULLANIMI VE MEKANSAL YAPIYA ETKİLERİ","D":"Ulasim turlerinin gelisimi ve mekansal yapilarin gelisimi surekli birbirleriyle ve nufus ile etkilesim halindedir. Bu faktorleri sekillendiren faktorler, farkli cografyalara bagli olarak farkliliklar gostermektedirler. Bu calismada, Ankara orneginde, ulasim turlerinin enerji tuketimlerine gore bir karsilastirmasi ortaya konarak, mekansal yapidaki degisimlerin bir degerlendirmesi yapilmistir.","S":[{"Ty":3,"U":"http://www.mmfdergi.gazi.edu.tr/article/download/1061000407/1061000375"},{"Ty":1,"U":"http://www.mmfdergi.gazi.edu.tr/article/view/1061000407"}],"DOI":"10.17341/gummfd.87531"}

entities.Ti: a cycling highway for vienna applying survey methods for the estimation of potential users
entities.E: {"DN":"A CYCLING HIGHWAY FOR VIENNA - APPLYING SURVEY METHODS FOR THE ESTIMATION OF POTENTIAL USERS","D":"In the wake of building a pedestrian bridge, the municipality of Vienna thought about the reuse of nearby old public transit structure as a bicycle path and asked for an estimation of future user numbers. The estimation was done by means of a small-scale survey of cycling structures and their users and an analysis of the survey’s results. Furthermore, conclusions and needs for future cycling-related forecasting methods are drawn","S":[{"Ty":3,"U":"http://www.svf.stuba.sk/docs/sjce/2007/2007_1/file1.pdf"}]}
